fast track.translation[0].definitions[0]: a way of achieving something more quickly than is normally done
a young actress on the fast track to fame and success
fast track.translation[1].definitions[0]: the fast track to something is the fastest way of achieving it
Many saw independence as the fast track to democracy.
fast track.translation[2].definitions[0]: happening or making progress more quickly than is usual
fast track.translation[3].definitions[0]: to help something happen or make progress more quickly than usual
Your application can be fast-tracked for a fee.
fast track.translation[4].definitions[0]: a quick and direct path to getting jobs that are more important and better paid
He is a middle manager in his 30s, on the fast track for promotion.
one of the bankâ€™s fast track graduates
